goals: Test current max on back squat (baseline: 255x3)
Test current max on bench press (baseline: 255x3)
Test current max on push press (baseline: 165x3)
Establish new training baselines for future programming
Maintain conditioning capacity with finishers and one longer session weekly
programContext.purpose: Conservative progression block focusing on the four main powerlifts (deadlift, squat, bench press, push press) with max testing in week 4 to establish new baselines. Designed for masters athlete with limited recovery capacity.

workoutTemplates.name: Fortis Fundamentum
workoutTemplates.description:
Back Squat
5x5 @ 205lbs (75% of working max)

Focus: Hit depth consistently every rep. Keep chest up, core braced. Feel your weight in mid-foot throughout the movement. Rest 3 minutes between sets.

This is accumulation phase - we're building volume tolerance and reinforcing movement patterns. Quality over ego here.

Scale: If depth or form breaks, reduce to 195lbs immediately.
workoutTemplates.notes: Film your third set if possible - I want to see depth consistency

workoutTemplates.name: Accessorius Posterior
workoutTemplates.description:
3 Rounds:
12 Bulgarian Split Squats (each leg) @ 40lb DBs
15 Romanian Deadlifts @ 135lbs
20 Banded Hamstring Curls

Rest 90 seconds between rounds.

Purpose: Build posterior chain strength to support your deadlift goal. Focus on the stretch and contraction. Control the eccentric (lowering phase) for 3 seconds on RDLs.

Bulgarians: Keep torso upright, drive through front heel. You're strong here - use it.
workoutTemplates.notes: This targets your weak points - squat and deadlift strength

workoutTemplates.name: Tempestus Minor
workoutTemplates.description:
10 Minute AMRAP:
12 Kettlebell Swings @ 53lbs
10 Box Step-Ups @ 24 inch (alternating legs)
8 Burpees

Pace: Steady, sustainable. Aim for 4-5 rounds. This is about work capacity, not sprinting. Keep breathing controlled - conversational to moderate breathlessness.

KB Swings: Hip hinge, explosive hip extension. Don't muscle it with arms.
Step-Ups: Full lockout at top, controlled descent.
Burpees: Chest to deck, full hip extension at top.
workoutTemplates.notes: Conditioning finisher - maintain strength recovery while building capacity

workoutTemplates.name: Pressa Maximus
workoutTemplates.description:
Bench Press
5x5 @ 215lbs (78% of working max)

Focus: Bar path over mid-chest, leg drive engaged, maintain arch. Touch chest every rep - no bouncing. Rest 3 minutes between sets.

This is your strength - we're building on it systematically. Feel your lats engage as you lower the bar. Drive through your feet.

Scale: If bar speed slows significantly or form breaks, reduce to 205lbs.
workoutTemplates.notes: Leverage your pressing strength - this should feel manageable at 78%

workoutTemplates.name: Tractus Fortis
workoutTemplates.description:
4 Rounds:
8 Weighted Pull-Ups @ 25lbs (or bodyweight if needed)
12 Barbell Rows @ 135lbs
15 Face Pulls @ moderate band
20 Banded Tricep Extensions

Rest 2 minutes between rounds.

Purpose: Build pulling volume and tricep strength to support pressing. Pull-ups: full ROM, chest to bar. Rows: pull to sternum, squeeze shoulder blades. Face pulls: external rotation focus for shoulder health.
workoutTemplates.notes: You're strong on pulling - use that. Face pulls address shoulder mobility work

workoutTemplates.name: Velocitas Ignis
workoutTemplates.description:
EMOM 12 Minutes:
Minute 1: 15 Calorie Row
Minute 2: 20 Kettlebell Swings @ 53lbs
Minute 3: 12 Box Jumps @ 24 inch (step down)

Pace: Each station should take 30-40 seconds, leaving 20-30 seconds rest. If you're going over 45 seconds, scale the reps.

Row: Hard effort, but sustainable for 4 rounds.
Swings: Unbroken sets, explosive hips.
Box Jumps: Full hip extension at top, step down for safety.
workoutTemplates.notes: Conditioning finisher - keep intensity moderate, focus on consistency

workoutTemplates.name: Mortis Trahens
workoutTemplates.description:
Deadlift
5x5 @ 230lbs (77% of working max)

Focus: Setup is everything. Weight in mid-foot, chest up, lats engaged before you pull. Feel your chest and hips rise together - no hip shoot.

Rest 3 minutes between sets. Film your third set - I want to see your hip timing.

This is your priority lift. We're building volume here to support your 315lb goal. Every rep should look identical.

Scale: If hips rise early or back rounds, reduce to 220lbs immediately.
workoutTemplates.notes: Film this - deadlift is your main goal and needs technical refinement

workoutTemplates.name: Dorsum Ferreus
workoutTemplates.description:
3 Rounds:
10 Deficit Deadlifts @ 185lbs (stand on 2 inch platform)
12 Single-Leg RDLs (each leg) @ 30lb DB
15 Barbell Rows @ 155lbs
20 Lat Pulldowns @ moderate weight

Rest 90 seconds between rounds.

Purpose: Strengthen your pulling pattern and posterior chain. Deficit deadlifts increase ROM and build bottom position strength.

Deficit DL: Same setup as regular deadlift, just more range. Control the descent.
Single-Leg RDL: Balance and hamstring strength. Keep hips square.
workoutTemplates.notes: This directly supports your deadlift weakness - execute with focus

workoutTemplates.name: Circuitus Infernus
workoutTemplates.description:
3 Rounds For Time:
400m Run
20 Kettlebell Swings @ 53lbs
15 Burpees

Time Cap: 18 minutes

Pace: Moderate intensity. This should feel like RPE 7-8, not maximal. Run at conversational pace, maintain form on swings and burpees even when tired.

Goal: Complete in 12-15 minutes. If you're hitting time cap, scale to 300m runs or reduce burpees to 12.
workoutTemplates.notes: Conditioning finisher - balance intensity with recovery for tomorrow

workoutTemplates.name: Impetus Potentia
workoutTemplates.description:
Push Press
5x5 @ 135lbs (75% estimated max, respecting shoulder mobility)

Focus: Explosive leg drive, press through as shoulders allow. Do NOT force overhead position beyond your mobility. Dip should be 4-6 inches, vertical torso.

Rest 3 minutes between sets.

Note: We're working within your shoulder mobility limits. If you feel pinching or can't achieve position, reduce weight or switch to more dip/less press.

Scale: If shoulder discomfort, reduce to 125lbs or increase leg drive component.
workoutTemplates.notes: Respect shoulder mobility limitations - no pain, modify as needed

workoutTemplates.name: Humeri Robustus
workoutTemplates.description:
4 Rounds:
10 Incline Dumbbell Press @ 55lb DBs
12 Dumbbell Shoulder Press @ 40lb DBs (within comfortable ROM)
15 Lateral Raises @ 20lb DBs
20 Dips (or bench dips if needed)

Rest 2 minutes between rounds.

Purpose: Build pressing volume and shoulder strength. DB shoulder press: only go as far as mobility allows comfortably - no forcing overhead position.

Incline press: Control the descent, explosive press.
Lateral raises: Slight forward angle, thumbs slightly down.
workoutTemplates.notes: Shoulder work within mobility limits - stop if any pinching occurs

workoutTemplates.name: Furia Metabolica
workoutTemplates.description:
12 Minute AMRAP:
15 Calorie Assault Bike
12 Dumbbell Thrusters @ 35lb DBs
9 Burpee Box Jump Overs @ 24 inch

Pace: This will get spicy. Start conservative - aim for 3-4 rounds. Bike should take 45-60 seconds. Thrusters unbroken if possible. Box jump overs: step down for safety.

This is higher intensity than previous finishers - embrace the discomfort but stay smart.
workoutTemplates.notes: Higher intensity finisher - push yourself but maintain movement quality

workoutTemplates.name: Fundamentum Profundus
workoutTemplates.description:
Front Squat
4x6 @ 165lbs (lighter load, focus on position)

Focus: Upright torso, elbows high, core braced. This builds quad strength and reinforces good squat mechanics. Pause 1 second in the bottom of each rep.

Rest 2.5 minutes between sets.

Purpose: Front squats address your squat weakness by forcing better positioning. The pause builds bottom position strength and confidence.

Scale: If you can't maintain upright torso, reduce to 155lbs.
workoutTemplates.notes: Front squats build the positions your back squat needs - focus on quality

workoutTemplates.name: Complexus Totalis
workoutTemplates.description:
3 Rounds:
10 Barbell Walking Lunges @ 95lbs (5 each leg)
12 Goblet Squats @ 53lb KB
15 Single-Leg Leg Press (each leg) @ moderate weight
20 Leg Curls @ moderate weight

Rest 90 seconds between rounds.

Purpose: Volume work for legs. Lunges are your strength - use them. Goblet squats reinforce upright positioning. Unilateral work addresses imbalances.

Lunges: Full ROM, knee tracks over toe, upright torso.
Goblet squats: Elbows inside knees at bottom, chest up.
workoutTemplates.notes: Leverage your lunge strength - this should feel good

workoutTemplates.name: Brevitas Intensus
workoutTemplates.description:
8 Minute AMRAP:
10 Calorie Row
10 Kettlebell Swings @ 53lbs
10 Box Step-Ups @ 24 inch

Pace: Moderate intensity, sustainable pace. This is a shorter finisher after higher volume leg work. Aim for 5-6 rounds.

Focus on consistent movement, not speed. Your legs will be fatigued - respect that.
workoutTemplates.notes: Shorter finisher - legs are already worked, keep it moderate

workoutTemplates.name: Aerobicus Maximus
workoutTemplates.description:
30 Minute CrossFit-Style Workout:

5 Rounds:
400m Run
15 Kettlebell Swings @ 53lbs
12 Box Jumps @ 24 inch (step down)
10 Burpees
15 Calorie Row

Pace: This is your longer conditioning day. Aim to complete in 25-30 minutes. Keep intensity at RPE 6-7, sustainable throughout. This builds aerobic capacity.

Break as needed to maintain form. Focus on breathing and pacing, not speed.

Goal: Finish all 5 rounds with consistent splits. If you're slowing significantly, scale movements.
workoutTemplates.notes: Longer conditioning session - focus on pacing and consistency over intensity

workoutTemplates.name: Recuperatio Dies
workoutTemplates.description:
Active Recovery & Mobility Work:

15-20 minutes total:

5 minutes: Light walking or easy bike

3 rounds:
- 10 Cat-Cow stretches
- 30 second Thoracic Bridge hold (each side)
- 10 Shoulder pass-throughs with PVC or band
- 30 second Deep Squat hold
- 10 Hip Circles (each direction)

Finish:
- 2 minutes Couch Stretch (each leg)
- 2 minutes Doorway Pec Stretch (each side)

Purpose: This is mandatory rest day work. You need this for shoulder and upper back mobility. Move slowly, breathe deeply, focus on positions.

No intensity. Just movement quality and tissue care.
workoutTemplates.notes: Complete rest day - mobility work only. This addresses your shoulder/upper back restrictions.

workoutTemplates.name: Fortis Progressio
workoutTemplates.description:
Back Squat
5x5 @ 210lbs (+5lbs from Week 1)

Focus: Same technical focus as Day 1. Depth, chest up, core braced. Feel your weight in mid-foot. Rest 3 minutes between sets.

Progression: We're adding 5lbs per week during accumulation. This should feel slightly harder but still manageable at RPE 7-8.

Film your heaviest set if possible.

Scale: If form breaks on any set, complete remaining sets at 205lbs.
workoutTemplates.notes: Progressive overload - 5lbs up from last week. Maintain form quality.

workoutTemplates.name: Unilateralis Potens
workoutTemplates.description:
4 Rounds:
10 Bulgarian Split Squats (each leg) @ 45lb DBs (+5lbs)
12 Walking Lunges @ 105lbs (+10lbs)
15 Goblet Squats @ 53lb KB
20 Glute Bridges @ bodyweight (3 second squeeze at top)

Rest 90 seconds between rounds.

Purpose: Progressive overload on your unilateral strength. Bulgarians and lunges are your strengths - we're pushing them.

Focus: Quality reps, full ROM, control throughout. Feel the working muscles.
workoutTemplates.notes: Load progression on your strengths - push these

workoutTemplates.name: Vortex Rapidus
workoutTemplates.description:
EMOM 15 Minutes:
Minute 1: 18 Calorie Row
Minute 2: 15 Kettlebell Swings @ 53lbs
Minute 3: 15 Burpees

Pace: Each station should take 40-50 seconds. This is slightly higher volume than Week 1 EMOM. Push the pace but maintain movement quality.

If you're consistently going over 50 seconds, scale reps by 2-3.
workoutTemplates.notes: Volume increase from Week 1 - slightly harder conditioning stimulus

workoutTemplates.name: Pressa Ascendens
workoutTemplates.description:
Bench Press
5x5 @ 220lbs (+5lbs from Week 1)

Focus: Bar path, leg drive, arch maintenance. Touch chest every rep. Rest 3 minutes between sets.

This is systematic progression on your pressing strength. Bar speed should still be good at this weight.

Scale: If bar speed slows significantly or you miss reps, complete remaining sets at 215lbs.
workoutTemplates.notes: 5lb progression - maintain technical quality

workoutTemplates.name: Tractus Intensus
workoutTemplates.description:
4 Rounds:
6 Weighted Pull-Ups @ 35lbs (+10lbs)
10 Barbell Rows @ 145lbs (+10lbs)
12 Single-Arm Dumbbell Rows @ 60lb DB (each arm)
15 Dumbbell Pullovers @ 50lb DB

Rest 2 minutes between rounds.

Purpose: Progressive overload on pulling strength. This supports both your bench press and deadlift.

Pull-ups: Full ROM, control the descent.
Barbell rows: Explosive pull, controlled lower.
DB rows: Minimize rotation, pull elbow past ribs.
workoutTemplates.notes: Load increases on pulling - you can handle this

workoutTemplates.name: Gladiator Brevitas
workoutTemplates.description:
10 Minute AMRAP:
200m Run
15 Dumbbell Snatches @ 40lb DB (alternating arms)
12 Box Jump Overs @ 24 inch

Pace: Moderate to moderate-high intensity. Run should take 50-60 seconds. Aim for 4-5 rounds.

DB Snatches: Explosive hip extension, punch overhead. Alternate arms every rep.
Box Jump Overs: Step down, full hip extension at top.
workoutTemplates.notes: New movement pattern (DB snatch) - focus on hip drive, not arm pull

workoutTemplates.name: Mortis Progressus
workoutTemplates.description:
Deadlift
5x5 @ 235lbs (+5lbs from Week 1)

Focus: Setup, lats engaged, chest and hips rise together. Rest 3 minutes between sets.

Progression: 5lbs up from last week. This is building toward your 315lb goal systematically.

Film your third set - I want to see if the hip timing has improved from last week.

Scale: If form breaks (hips shoot, back rounds), reduce to 230lbs immediately.
workoutTemplates.notes: Progressive overload on your priority lift - film this for analysis

workoutTemplates.name: Catena Posterior
workoutTemplates.description:
3 Rounds:
8 Deficit Deadlifts @ 195lbs (+10lbs)
10 Romanian Deadlifts @ 145lbs (+10lbs)
12 Good Mornings @ 95lbs
15 Glute-Ham Raises (or Nordic curls if available)

Rest 2 minutes between rounds.

Purpose: Systematic progression on posterior chain work. This directly supports deadlift strength.

Deficit DL: Increased ROM builds bottom strength.
RDLs: Feel the hamstring stretch, control the eccentric.
Good mornings: Hinge pattern reinforcement.
workoutTemplates.notes: Load progression on deadlift accessories - this builds your weakness

workoutTemplates.name: Chipper Brutalis
workoutTemplates.description:
For Time:
50 Kettlebell Swings @ 53lbs
40 Box Step-Ups @ 24 inch
30 Dumbbell Thrusters @ 35lb DBs
20 Burpees
10 Calorie Assault Bike (sprint finish)

Time Cap: 15 minutes

Pace: This is a chipper - work through it steadily. Break movements before failure. Goal is 10-12 minutes.

Swings: Sets of 15-20
Step-ups: Steady pace
Thrusters: Sets of 5-10
Burpees: Breathe, maintain rhythm
Bike: Empty the tank
workoutTemplates.notes: Chipper format - pace yourself, break before failure

workoutTemplates.name: Impetus Crescens
workoutTemplates.description:
Push Press
5x5 @ 140lbs (+5lbs from Week 1)

Focus: Explosive leg drive, press through within shoulder mobility limits. Rest 3 minutes between sets.

Progression: 5lbs up. This should still feel manageable with good leg drive.

Reminder: Do not force overhead position beyond your mobility. Quality over load.

Scale: If shoulder discomfort or can't achieve position, stay at 135lbs.
workoutTemplates.notes: Progressive overload within shoulder mobility limits

workoutTemplates.name: Voluminis Pressus
workoutTemplates.description:
4 Rounds:
8 Incline Dumbbell Press @ 60lb DBs (+5lbs)
10 Dumbbell Shoulder Press @ 45lb DBs (+5lbs, within ROM)
12 Dips (weighted if possible +10-25lbs)
15 Overhead Tricep Extensions @ 40lb DB
20 Face Pulls @ band

Rest 2 minutes between rounds.

Purpose: Progressive overload on pressing volume. Face pulls maintain shoulder health.

Incline press: Explosive concentric, controlled eccentric.
Shoulder press: Only to comfortable ROM.
Dips: Full ROM if shoulder allows.
workoutTemplates.notes: Load progression on pressing accessories - respect shoulder limits

workoutTemplates.name: Intervalum Potentia
workoutTemplates.description:
5 Rounds:
1 minute Assault Bike (hard effort)
1 minute Rest
1 minute Row (hard effort)
1 minute Rest

Total: 20 minutes

Pace: This is interval work. Go hard during work periods (RPE 8-9), recover during rest. Track calories each round - aim for consistency.

Goal: Build cardiovascular capacity with high-intensity intervals.
workoutTemplates.notes: Interval training - push hard during work periods, recover fully during rest

workoutTemplates.name: Variatio Crura
workoutTemplates.description:
Front Squat
4x6 @ 170lbs (+5lbs from Day 5)

Focus: Upright torso, elbows high, 1 second pause in bottom. Rest 2.5 minutes between sets.

Progression: 5lbs up from last week. This continues building quad strength and squat positioning.

Purpose: Front squats address your back squat weakness through better mechanics.

Scale: If torso folds forward, reduce to 165lbs.
workoutTemplates.notes: Progressive overload on squat variation - maintain position quality

workoutTemplates.name: Hypertrophia Crura
workoutTemplates.description:
3 Rounds:
8 Barbell Walking Lunges @ 105lbs (4 each leg, +10lbs)
10 Goblet Squats @ 60lb KB (+7lbs)
12 Step-Ups @ 50lb DBs (each leg)
15 Leg Extensions @ moderate weight
20 Calf Raises @ bodyweight

Rest 90 seconds between rounds.

Purpose: Higher volume leg work. This is hypertrophy-focused to build muscle that supports strength.

Lunges: Your strength - push the load.
Goblet squats: Deep, chest up.
Step-ups: Controlled, full lockout.
workoutTemplates.notes: Volume and load progression - this builds muscle to support strength goals

workoutTemplates.name: Metabolicus Finalis
workoutTemplates.description:
3 Rounds For Time:
20 Calorie Row
15 Dumbbell Thrusters @ 35lb DBs
10 Burpee Box Jump Overs @ 24 inch
5 Wall Walks

Time Cap: 18 minutes

Pace: This is higher complexity and volume. Break movements strategically. Goal is 12-15 minutes.

Row: Hard but sustainable.
Thrusters: Sets of 5.
Box jump overs: Step down.
Wall walks: Scale to push-ups if needed for shoulder safety.
workoutTemplates.notes: Higher complexity finisher - pace yourself and break before failure

workoutTemplates.name: Endurancia Magnus
workoutTemplates.description:
40 Minute Mixed Modality Endurance:

Complete as many rounds as possible in 40 minutes:
500m Row
400m Run
20 Kettlebell Swings @ 53lbs
15 Box Step-Ups @ 24 inch
10 Burpees

Pace: This is aerobic endurance work. Keep intensity at RPE 5-6, conversational pace throughout. Focus on consistent movement for the full 40 minutes.

Goal: Complete 5-6 full rounds with minimal rest between movements. This builds your aerobic base.

Break as needed to maintain pace and form quality.
workoutTemplates.notes: Longer aerobic endurance session - maintain conversational pace throughout

workoutTemplates.name: Mobilitas Recuperatio
workoutTemplates.description:
Active Recovery & Extended Mobility Work:

25-30 minutes total:

5 minutes: Easy bike or walk

4 rounds:
- 12 Cat-Cow stretches (slow, controlled)
- 45 second Thoracic Bridge hold (each side)
- 12 Shoulder pass-throughs with band
- 45 second Deep Squat hold (work on depth)
- 12 Hip Circles (each direction)
- 10 Scapular Push-Ups

Finish:
- 3 minutes Couch Stretch (each leg)
- 3 minutes Doorway Pec Stretch (each side)
- 2 minutes Child's Pose with reaches
- 2 minutes Supine Twist (each side)

Purpose: End of 2-week accumulation block. Your body needs this recovery work. Focus on breathing and tissue quality.

No intensity. Just movement and mobility.
workoutTemplates.notes: Extended mobility work - you've earned this after 2 weeks of volume accumulation

workoutTemplates.name: Fortis Squat
workoutTemplates.description:
Back Squat
5x3 @ 225lbs (82% of estimated 1RM ~275lbs)

This is intensity building - focus on explosive drive out of the hole while maintaining perfect form. Bar speed matters here. Rest 3-4 minutes between sets to stay fresh.

Coaching cues: Keep chest up, feel your weight in mid-foot, drive knees out. Film a set if possible - I want to see your depth consistency.

Scale: If form breaks or bar speed slows significantly, reduce to 215lbs.
workoutTemplates.notes: Video analysis recommended for form check

workoutTemplates.name: Gladiator Legs
workoutTemplates.description:
Bulgarian Split Squats
4x8 each leg @ 50lb dumbbells

Pause Squats (3 second pause at bottom)
3x5 @ 185lbs

Walking Lunges
3x20 steps (10 each leg) @ 40lb dumbbells

These accessories target your squat weak points. The Bulgarian split squats build unilateral strength, pause squats improve your bottom position, and lunges leverage your existing strength. Rest 90 seconds between movements.

Focus: Control and quality over speed.
workoutTemplates.notes: Accessory work to strengthen squat weak points

workoutTemplates.name: Infernus Sprint
workoutTemplates.description:
10 minute AMRAP:
12 Kettlebell Swings (53lbs)
10 Box Step-Ups (24 inch, alternating legs)
8 Calories Assault Bike

Pace: This should feel like RPE 7-8. You're building intensity tolerance without crushing yourself. Aim for 4-5 rounds. Keep your breathing controlled and consistent.

This finisher maintains conditioning without compromising tomorrow's recovery.
workoutTemplates.notes: Conditioning finisher - moderate intensity

workoutTemplates.name: Dominus Press
workoutTemplates.description:
Bench Press
5x3 @ 225lbs (82% of estimated 1RM ~275lbs)

This is your strength - leverage it. Focus on explosive drive off the chest, solid leg drive, and maintaining your arch. Bar path should be tight. Rest 3-4 minutes between sets.

Coaching cues: Pull the bar apart, drive feet into ground, chest to bar contact should be consistent.

Scale: If bar speed slows or form breaks, drop to 215lbs. Quality over ego.
workoutTemplates.notes: Leverage existing bench strength

workoutTemplates.name: Titan Shoulders
workoutTemplates.description:
Close-Grip Bench Press
4x6 @ 185lbs

Dumbbell Incline Press
3x10 @ 60lb dumbbells

Dumbbell Rows
4x12 each arm @ 70lbs

Tricep work and upper back volume to support your pressing. The close-grip builds lockout strength, incline hits upper chest, rows balance the pressing volume. Rest 90 seconds between movements.

Focus: Controlled tempo, full range of motion on rows.
workoutTemplates.notes: Pressing accessories and upper back balance

workoutTemplates.name: Tempestus Burn
workoutTemplates.description:
EMOM 12 minutes:
Minute 1: 15 Calories Row
Minute 2: 12 Dumbbell Push Press (35lbs each hand)
Minute 3: 15 Kettlebell Swings (53lbs)
Minute 4: Rest

Repeat 3 times through (12 minutes total).

Pace: Each minute should leave you 15-20 seconds rest. This is about sustainable intensity. RPE 7-8.

This finisher keeps conditioning sharp without destroying your recovery.
workoutTemplates.notes: EMOM conditioning - controlled intensity

workoutTemplates.name: Maximus Deadlift
workoutTemplates.description:
Deadlift
5x3 @ 255lbs (85% of current working max ~300lbs)

This is intensity week - we're building toward your 315 goal. Focus on explosive pull off the floor while maintaining perfect setup. Your hips and chest should rise together. Rest 4-5 minutes between sets.

Coaching cues: Feel tension in your hamstrings before you pull, keep the bar close to your body, chest up throughout. Film your heaviest set - I need to see your form under load.

Scale: If hips shoot up early or form breaks, reduce to 245lbs immediately.
workoutTemplates.notes: Video analysis critical - this is your weak point

workoutTemplates.name: Colossus Pull
workoutTemplates.description:
Romanian Deadlifts
4x8 @ 185lbs

Pull-Ups (Strict)
4x8 reps

Barbell Rows
3x10 @ 135lbs

Single-Leg RDLs
3x10 each leg @ 40lb dumbbell

Posterior chain volume and pulling strength. The RDLs build your hamstrings for deadlift lockout, pull-ups and rows leverage your existing pulling strength. Rest 90 seconds between movements.

Focus: Feel the stretch in your hamstrings on RDLs, full range on pull-ups.
workoutTemplates.notes: Posterior chain and pulling volume

workoutTemplates.name: Vulcan Forge
workoutTemplates.description:
3 Rounds For Time:
15 Kettlebell Swings (53lbs)
12 Box Jumps (24 inch - step down)
9 Burpees

Time Cap: 12 minutes

Pace: This should be challenging but sustainable. Aim for sub-10 minutes. Break up movements strategically - don't go to failure on any single set.

This finisher tests your conditioning under fatigue. Push the pace but stay controlled.
workoutTemplates.notes: Conditioning finisher - moderate to high intensity

workoutTemplates.name: Potentia Press
workoutTemplates.description:
Push Press
5x3 @ 145lbs (85% of estimated working max ~170lbs)

This is your explosive pressing work. Focus on aggressive leg drive and fast bar speed. Don't let shoulder mobility limit you - use that leg drive. Rest 3 minutes between sets.

Coaching cues: Dip straight down, explosive drive through heels, punch the bar overhead fast. Keep core tight throughout.

Scale: If shoulder position feels compromised or bar speed slows, reduce to 135lbs. Respect your shoulder mobility limitations.
workoutTemplates.notes: Modified for shoulder mobility - emphasize leg drive

workoutTemplates.name: Hercules Arms
workoutTemplates.description:
Dumbbell Shoulder Press (seated)
4x8 @ 50lb dumbbells

Dumbbell Lateral Raises
3x12 @ 25lbs

Barbell Curls
3x10 @ 75lbs

Tricep Dips (bodyweight or assisted)
3x12 reps

Upper body accessory volume. Seated press respects shoulder mobility, lateral raises build deltoid strength, arms get some direct work. Rest 90 seconds between movements.

Focus: Control the eccentric, don't swing weights.
workoutTemplates.notes: Upper body accessory with shoulder-friendly movements

workoutTemplates.name: Ares Assault
workoutTemplates.description:
AMRAP 10 minutes:
10 Dumbbell Thrusters (35lbs each hand)
12 Calories Row
14 Kettlebell Swings (53lbs)

Pace: RPE 7-8, sustainable but challenging. Aim for 3-4 rounds. Break up thrusters if needed - they'll be the limiting factor under fatigue.

This finisher combines strength endurance with conditioning. Stay consistent.
workoutTemplates.notes: Conditioning finisher - strength endurance focus

workoutTemplates.name: Imperator Squat
workoutTemplates.description:
Front Squat
5x5 @ 165lbs

Back Squat (Volume)
3x8 @ 205lbs (75% of estimated 1RM)

This is a volume day to build work capacity. Front squats challenge your core and upper back positioning, then back squats add volume. Rest 2-3 minutes between sets.

Coaching cues: Front squats - elbows high, chest up. Back squats - focus on consistent depth across all 8 reps.

Scale: If form degrades, reduce front squat to 155lbs, back squat to 195lbs.
workoutTemplates.notes: Volume day for squat development

workoutTemplates.name: Spartacus Core
workoutTemplates.description:
Plank Hold
4x60 seconds

Dead Bugs
3x20 reps (10 each side)

Pallof Press
3x12 each side @ light resistance

Hanging Knee Raises
3x12 reps

Core stability work to support your main lifts. These movements build anti-rotation and anti-extension strength. Rest 60 seconds between movements.

Focus: Quality over speed, maintain tension throughout.
workoutTemplates.notes: Core stability for powerlifting support

workoutTemplates.name: Cyclone Chaos
workoutTemplates.description:
For Time:
21-15-9 reps of:
Kettlebell Swings (53lbs)
Box Step-Ups (24 inch, alternating)
Calories Assault Bike

Time Cap: 15 minutes

Pace: This is a classic descending rep scheme. Push the 21s, stay consistent on 15s, sprint the 9s. Aim for sub-12 minutes.

This finisher tests your ability to maintain intensity as volume decreases.
workoutTemplates.notes: Classic 21-15-9 conditioning finisher

workoutTemplates.name: Olympus Endurance
workoutTemplates.description:
30 Minute CrossFit-Style Conditioning:

AMRAP 30 minutes:
400m Run (or 500m Row)
15 Kettlebell Swings (53lbs)
12 Box Step-Ups (24 inch)
9 Burpees

This is your longer conditioning day. Pace yourself - aim for 5-6 rounds. This should feel like RPE 6-7, sustainable aerobic work. Don't sprint, just keep moving consistently.

Scale: If needed, reduce to 20 minutes or modify movements (step-up burpees instead of full burpees).

This builds your aerobic base without crushing your recovery for next week.
workoutTemplates.notes: Longer conditioning session - aerobic capacity focus

workoutTemplates.name: Recupero Mobility
workoutTemplates.description:
Active Recovery & Mobility Work:

Shoulder Mobility Sequence (10 minutes):
- Wall slides: 3x10 reps
- Band pull-aparts: 3x15 reps
- Doorway chest stretch: 3x30 seconds each side
- Shoulder dislocates with PVC: 3x10 reps

Upper Back Mobility (10 minutes):
- Foam roll thoracic spine: 3 minutes
- Cat-cow stretches: 3x10 reps
- Thread the needle: 3x30 seconds each side
- Child's pose with side reaches: 3x30 seconds each side

Hip Mobility (10 minutes):
- Couch stretch: 2 minutes each side
- Pigeon pose: 2 minutes each side
- 90/90 hip stretch: 2 minutes each side
- Deep squat hold: 3 minutes accumulated

This is your rest day. Light movement, stretching, and mobility work. Address your shoulder and upper back restrictions. This is non-negotiable recovery work.

You need this. Execute it.
workoutTemplates.notes: Mandatory rest day - focus on shoulder and upper back mobility

workoutTemplates.name: Requies Mobilitas
workoutTemplates.description:
Active Recovery Day

Today is about dissipating fatigue and preparing your body for max testing ahead. Light movement only.

10 minutes:
- 2 min easy bike or row
- Shoulder circles: 10 forward, 10 backward
- Thoracic extensions over foam roller: 15 reps
- Cat-cow: 10 reps
- Hip circles: 10 each direction
- Bodyweight squats: 15 reps (focus on depth)
- Walk 5 minutes easy pace

Stretch major muscle groups for 10 minutes: quads, hamstrings, glutes, chest, lats. Hold each 60-90 seconds.

This is NOT a workout. Keep it light. You're recovering, not training.
workoutTemplates.notes: Complete rest and recovery. No heavy lifting. Keep heart rate low.

workoutTemplates.name: Testamentum Posterior
workoutTemplates.description:
Deadlift Max Test Day

Warm-up:
- 10 min easy movement: bike, row, walk
- Dynamic stretching: leg swings, hip openers
- Empty bar deadlifts: 2x10 (focus on form)
- 135lbs x 5
- 185lbs x 3
- 225lbs x 2
- 245lbs x 1
- 265lbs x 1

MAX ATTEMPT:
Work up to a heavy single. Your baseline is 285x3, so you should be capable of 300-310+ for a single.

Protocol:
- 275lbs x 1 (should feel smooth)
- 290lbs x 1 (moderate effort)
- 300-305lbs x 1 (hard effort)
- 310-315lbs x 1 (max attempt if previous felt good)

Rest 4-5 minutes between heavy singles. Film your top sets. Focus on keeping chest up, hips and chest rising together. This establishes your new baseline for the next training block.

If the bar speed slows significantly or form breaks, that's your max. Don't force it.
workoutTemplates.notes: Max effort day. Film top sets. Stop if form breaks. Rest 4-5 min between heavy singles.

workoutTemplates.name: Ventus Brevis
workoutTemplates.description:
Light Conditioning Finisher

10 minute EMOM:
Minute 1: 12 Cal Assault Bike (easy pace)
Minute 2: 15 KB Swings (35# - light)
Minute 3: 10 Box Step-Ups (20", alternating)

This should feel EASY. You just maxed your deadlift. Keep heart rate conversational. This is active recovery, not a workout. If you're breathing hard, you're going too hard.

Goal: movement and blood flow, not intensity.
workoutTemplates.notes: Keep this LIGHT. Active recovery only. Conversational pace throughout.

workoutTemplates.name: Testamentum Pectoris
workoutTemplates.description:
Bench Press Max Test Day

Warm-up:
- 5 min easy bike or row
- Arm circles, shoulder mobility work
- Band pull-aparts: 2x20
- Empty bar bench: 2x15
- 95lbs x 10
- 135lbs x 5
- 185lbs x 3
- 205lbs x 2
- 225lbs x 1
- 245lbs x 1

MAX ATTEMPT:
Work up to a heavy single. Your baseline is 255x3, so you're looking at 280-295+ for a single.

Protocol:
- 265lbs x 1 (should feel smooth)
- 280lbs x 1 (moderate effort)
- 290lbs x 1 (hard effort)
- 295-300lbs x 1 (max attempt if previous felt good)

Rest 4-5 minutes between heavy singles. Film your top sets. Focus on leg drive, tight upper back, controlled descent. This is your strength - let's see what you've got.

Bar path should be straight. If you lose tightness or bar speed dies, that's your max.
workoutTemplates.notes: Max effort day. Film top sets. Maintain leg drive and upper back tightness. Rest 4-5 min between heavy singles.

workoutTemplates.name: Flamma Parva
workoutTemplates.description:
Light Conditioning Finisher

8 minute AMRAP (easy pace):
10 Cal Row
10 DB Bench Press (25# DBs - light)
10 Sit-Ups

This is LIGHT work. You just maxed bench. Keep everything controlled and easy. Focus on movement quality, not speed. Aim for 3-4 rounds.

If your chest is pumped or fatigued, scale the DB bench to 20# or even 15#. This is recovery work.
workoutTemplates.notes: Keep this LIGHT. Recovery work only. Scale DB weight if needed.

workoutTemplates.name: Testamentum Quadriceps
workoutTemplates.description:
Back Squat Max Test Day

Warm-up:
- 10 min easy bike or row
- Hip mobility: hip circles, leg swings, deep bodyweight squats
- Empty bar squats: 2x10 (focus on depth)
- 95lbs x 8
- 135lbs x 5
- 165lbs x 3
- 195lbs x 2
- 215lbs x 1
- 235lbs x 1

MAX ATTEMPT:
Work up to a heavy single. Your baseline is 255x3, so you should hit 275-285+ for a single.

Protocol:
- 255lbs x 1 (should feel smooth)
- 270lbs x 1 (moderate effort)
- 280lbs x 1 (hard effort)
- 285-290lbs x 1 (max attempt if previous felt good)

Rest 4-5 minutes between heavy singles. Film ALL your heavy sets - squat is your weak point, I need to see what's happening. Focus on hitting depth consistently, chest up, knees tracking over toes.

This is your opportunity to establish a new baseline. Don't leave weight on the bar, but don't sacrifice depth for weight.
workoutTemplates.notes: Max effort day. FILM ALL HEAVY SETS. Depth is non-negotiable. Rest 4-5 min between heavy singles.

workoutTemplates.name: Tempestas Brevis
workoutTemplates.description:
Light Conditioning Finisher

10 minute EMOM:
Minute 1: 10 Cal Bike (easy)
Minute 2: 12 Air Squats (bodyweight only - focus on depth)
Minute 3: 8 KB Swings (35# - light)

You just maxed squats. Keep this EASY. The air squats are for movement quality and blood flow, not intensity. If your legs are smoked, do 8 air squats instead of 12.

Conversational pace. Active recovery.
workoutTemplates.notes: Keep this LIGHT. Active recovery only. Scale air squat reps if needed.

workoutTemplates.name: Testamentum Impetus
workoutTemplates.description:
Push Press Max Test Day

Warm-up:
- 5 min easy bike or row
- Shoulder mobility work: circles, band pull-aparts, thoracic extensions
- Empty bar push press: 2x10 (focus on dip and drive)
- 75lbs x 8
- 95lbs x 5
- 115lbs x 3
- 135lbs x 2
- 145lbs x 1
- 155lbs x 1

MAX ATTEMPT:
Work up to a heavy single. Your baseline is approximately 165x3, so you're looking at 180-190+ for a single.

Protocol:
- 165lbs x 1 (should feel smooth)
- 175lbs x 1 (moderate effort)
- 185lbs x 1 (hard effort - THIS IS YOUR GOAL)
- 190-195lbs x 1 (max attempt if 185 felt good)

Rest 3-4 minutes between heavy singles. Remember your shoulder mobility limitations - don't force the overhead position. The push press uses leg drive, so focus on explosive dip and drive, then lock out at the top.

If you feel shoulder discomfort, stop. We respect the limitations. Film your top sets.
workoutTemplates.notes: Max effort day. Respect shoulder limitations. Focus on leg drive. Film top sets. Rest 3-4 min between heavy singles.

workoutTemplates.name: Ferrum Levis
workoutTemplates.description:
Light Upper Body Accessory Work

3 Rounds (not for time, quality reps):
10 DB Rows each arm (40# - moderate weight)
12 DB Bench Press (30# DBs - light)
15 Band Pull-Aparts
10 DB Shoulder Press (20# DBs - LIGHT, respect shoulder mobility)
Rest 90 seconds between rounds

This is light accessory work after max testing. Focus on movement quality and muscle engagement, not weight. Your shoulders just got tested - keep the DB press light and controlled.

If anything feels off, skip it. You're done with max testing for this phase.
workoutTemplates.notes: Light accessory work. Quality over intensity. Respect shoulder limitations on DB press.

workoutTemplates.name: Gladiator Endura
workoutTemplates.description:
Longer Conditioning Session

25 minute AMRAP (steady pace):
200m Row
15 KB Swings (53#)
10 Box Step-Ups (24", alternating legs)
15 Sit-Ups
10 Push-Ups

This is your longer conditioning day for the week. You've completed all max testing. Today is about maintaining conditioning capacity while keeping intensity moderate.

Pace yourself - aim for 4-5 rounds. Keep breathing controlled. This should feel like steady work, not all-out effort. You're building aerobic capacity, not testing max effort.

If you're crushing this and want more challenge, increase KB swing weight to 62# or add 5 burpees per round. But keep the pace sustainable.
workoutTemplates.notes: Longer conditioning session. Steady sustainable pace. Aim for 4-5 rounds. Scale as needed.

workoutTemplates.name: Requies Completus
workoutTemplates.description:
Complete Rest Day

You've completed max testing on all four lifts this week. Today is COMPLETE rest. No workout. No conditioning. Just recovery.

Optional (if you feel like it):
- 10-15 minute walk (easy pace)
- Light stretching: major muscle groups, 60 seconds each
- Foam rolling: focus on quads, hamstrings, glutes, upper back

Prioritize sleep tonight. Eat well. Hydrate. Let your body recover from the testing week.

We'll review your max numbers and plan the next training block. You've earned this rest day.
workoutTemplates.notes: COMPLETE REST. No training. Optional light movement only. Prioritize sleep and nutrition.
